channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: Vivaldi 7.6 Brings Reader Mode to iPhone and Android
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: A few much needed features have been added to the iPhone and Android apps.
item.content:encoded: Vivaldi 7.6 is officially out on mobile platforms, and this update brings some much-needed features to iOS and Android. Vivaldi’s latest release brings in reader mode, better tab management, and that polish under the hood that makes browsing much smoother.

item.title: Kanto Audio Joins the Vinyl Revival With Its First Ever Turntable, and It's $199
item.dc:creator: Derek Malcolm
item.description: The Canadian speaker maker is branching out into to world of vinyl records.
item.content:encoded: The designers at Canadian audio brand Kanto Audio are best known for building great speakers, so it's no surprise that they've taken the plunge into the vinyl revival. Meet the company's first turntable: the cute and cuddly Obi3.

item.title: Android Fragmentation Isn’t Going Away—And That’s Great, Actually
item.dc:creator: Sydney Butler
item.description: The whole is more than the sum of its parts.
item.content:encoded: One common criticism of Android phones, tablets, and other devices is "fragmentation". In other words, the fact that there are many different extant versions of Android, numerous devices with different specifications and abilities and, therefore, a tough job for anyone who wants to support it all.

item.title: Microsoft OneDrive Is Getting an Overhaul
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: A few much-needed features are on the way.
item.content:encoded: Microsoft just dropped a bombshell of updates for OneDrive. The company is once again forcing more Copilot features into another app in its suite, but that is coming with other changes that will make OneDrive a lot better for users.

item.title: System76's Newest Laptop Comes With COSMIC
item.dc:creator: Arol Wright
item.content:encoded: System76's COSMIC desktop environment has been hugely popular lately. It's highly customizable in ways very few Linux distros are, and it's also extremely fast and tweakable. It's not fully stable yet, but that's not stopping System76 from shipping a computer with it.

item.title: Ubuntu Linux 25.10 Has Arrived
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: This is mostly to get ready for the LTS in 2026.
item.content:encoded: Canonical today announced the release of Ubuntu 25.10, codenamed “Questing Quokka.” This update comes with improvements across security, compatibility, and the core desktop experience and is likely very important for the long-term support (LTS) coming in 2026.

item.title: How to Insert an In-Cell Picture in Microsoft Excel
item.dc:creator: Tony Phillips
item.description: Make pictures an integral part of your Excel spreadsheet.
item.content:encoded: Adding pictures to a Microsoft Excel worksheet can improve visualization, understanding, and overall presentation. However, floating images are notorious for causing layout issues when rows, columns, and cells are modified. To avoid these problems, you can embed pictures within cells.

item.title: Google TV Might Borrow This Divisive Netflix Feature
item.dc:creator: Cory Gunther
item.content:encoded: Do you like to fall asleep with the TV on, but then wake up and realize you missed several episodes of your favorite show? If so, we have some potentially good news. It looks like Google TV is preparing to borrow a Netflix feature that users either love or hate.

item.title: How to Watch Your Favorite Comfort Show Without an Overpriced Subscription
item.dc:creator: Adam Davidson
item.description: Don't let subscription fees get in the way of watching your guilty pleasure.
item.content:encoded: We all have songs that are our guilty pleasures, and the same is true for TV shows. For me, it's the show Friday Night Lights. The five seasons about the trials and tribulations of a Texas high school football team are cheesy and predictable, but just really comforting to watch. If you're tired of paying a premium to watch your favorite comfort show on a streaming service, then the good news is that there are alternatives.

item.title: How the Ford Bronco Beats the Jeep Wrangler at Its Own Game
item.dc:creator: Tyler Dupont
item.description: The Ford Bronco outperforms the Jeep Wrangler with better tech, comfort, and off-road capability.
item.content:encoded: Few rivalries in the automotive world are as fierce as Ford versus Jeep, and nowhere is that battle more heated than in the off-road segment. For years, the Wrangler has been the benchmark for trail-ready SUVs, but Ford’s modern off-roader is proving it can play by the same rules and still come out ahead.
